title: download-url fails on URLs that end with a /

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
#### What is the problem?

download-url uses the filename from the base of the url. If a URL is a directory-ish URL that ends with a `/`, it resolves to the root of the current dataset and dies with a non-intuitive error about the file already existing.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Run download-url on a URL that ends with a `/`. ie:

```
$ datalad download-url https://www.google.com/
[INFO   ] Downloading 'https://www.google.com/' into '/Users/driusan/Data/datalad-test' 
download_url(error): /Users/driusan/Data/datalad-test (file) [File /Users/driusan/Data/datalad-test/ already exists [base.py:_download:299]]
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

```
DataLad
=======
Version     : 0.10.0
Full version: 0.10.0

System
======
OS          : posix Darwin 17.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.5.0: Fri Apr 13 19:32:32 PDT 2018; root:xnu-4570.51.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64
Distribution:  10.13.4/x86_64

Locale/Encoding
===============
default        : ascii
filesystem     : utf-8
locale.prefered: UTF-8

Environment
===========
LC_CTYPE='en_CA.UTF-8'
PATH='/usr/local/opt/php72/bin:/usr/local/bin:/home/driusan/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/go/bin:/Users/driusan/bin/:/Users/driusan/Code/Go/src/github.com/driusan/de/scripts:/usr/local/plan9/bin:/Users/driusan/Code/Go/bin'
LANG='en_CA.UTF-8'
GIT_EDITOR='ed'

Externals
=========
appdirs=1.4.3
boto=2.48.0
cmd:annex=6.20170818
cmd:git=2.13.0

====================

=========================

```
